title: $$\frac{Equation}{Substitute}$$
text: The equation for calculating the rate of change is $$\frac{p\left(x_1\right)-p\left(x_2\right)}{x_1-x_2}$$. So to find the answer, we can start by plugging in $$2+h$$ for $$x_1$$ and 2 for $$x_2$$, and we get the expression $$\frac{3\left(2+h\right)+4-3\left(2\right)+4}{2+h-2}$$.

title: Simplify
text: Simplify the expression $$\frac{3\left(2+h\right)+4-3\left(2\right)+4}{2+h-2}$$. What do you get?
